abstract.p: Shares of Rambus rise after memory chip designer reaches licensing agreement with NEC of Japan (S)

block.p: Shares of Rambus rose yesterday after the memory chip designer said it had reached a licensing agreement with NEC of Japan. NEC is the world's second-largest chip maker and the biggest one to sign a licensing agreement with Rambus, which is embroiled in lawsuits over licensing royalties. It is the fourth such deal for Rambus, which designs but does not make memory chips. Rambus shares finished up $6.50, or 8 percent, at $83.31.
